Very few wealthy people have high income, salaried jobs. Most are entrepreneurs or other creative professionals. Some leave high-income careers like engineering or medicine to invest. Most don’t hit the very wealthy part, though. It’s mostly people who own companies, invest lots of money that they’ve already made, or do something highly creative that disrupts art or technology. Some people, like athletes or celebrities, technically have a “job,” but a lot of the decisions or contracts involve their inputs, particularly at the “rich” level.
